content: boatneck raglan jumper here s an easy top you can create in no time a perfect project for spring or the end of summer it s light on yarn usage too because every second round is filet stitch the boatneck raglan jumper is worked seamlessly in one piece from the top down to begin the yoke is worked down to the armholes making 4 sets of raglan increases to form the diagonal lines which run from the neck edge to the underarms the sleeve stitches are then ignored for a while and just the body section worked in joined rounds down to the hem the sleeves are then worked top down by joining at each underarm and working from those previously ignored stitches down to the desired length page 1 boatneck raglan jumper sizes/measurements/fit all size measurements are for garment not body this garment is generously sized garments lengths are not given as you just keep working down to the length you want neck circumference for all sizes is 20 chest small s 38 / 97cm medium m 40 / 102cm large l 42 / 107cm extra large xl 44 / 112cm materials for a jumper with ¾ sleeves you will need between 720m / 790yds / 180g and 1000m / 1094yds / 250g of sock weight aus 4ply yarn and a 5mm hook gauge gauge is 4 stitches/inch however as all sizes start the same you can try on and adjust for size as you go notes  skill level confident beginner  standard american terminology  v_stitch = v = dc1 ch1 dc1  at the start of each round work the 1st double_crochet as ch3 so 1st v each round = ch4 dc1  at the end of each round join with slip_stitch to 1st double_crochet made with chains  pattern instructions are given for size small with other sizes in brackets following schematics plan view after 1st few rounds yoke completed to armholes body completed of yoke ready to divide for body sleeves short or ¾ length page 2 boatneck raglan jumper instructions please read the notes above for details on working the start and end of rounds yoke foundation all sizes ch84 for approx 20 in the setup round the raglan shaping is established with v stitches between the 4 sides setup v dc9 v dc31 x 2 slip_stitch join to 1st double_crochet all sizes 88 double_crochet + 4 chain = 92 stitches in round 1 filet crochet stitch is worked on all sides with a v_stitch between into each v_stitch round 1 slip_stitch to ch1 space v * ch1 skip1 dc1 repeat from * to just before 1st double_crochet of next v ch1 skip1 x 4 slip_stitch join to 1st double_crochet all sizes 50 double_crochet + 50 chain = 100 stitches in round 2 solid double_crochet stitch is worked on all sides with a v_stitch between into each v_stitch round 2 slip_stitch to ch1 space v double_crochet in each double_crochet to and including double_crochet
